geeklist.title: Asmodee Publisher List
geeklist.description:
[size=24][center][b]Please read the details in the description and comments for each entry, don't just glance at the titles[/b][/center][/size]
I'm not saying you should boycott these publishers' games, I'm just listing them for informational purposes.
This list started as a list of publishers listed on Asmodee's North America site. There was a [thread=2372161]thread[/thread] about their latest change in business practices and people were saying they would like such a list.
I've opened up the list so other users can add items. I'm hoping no one gets added to this list without real research/knowledge first. I do NOT have time to police all the entries so hopefully other users will chime in if someone posts something that doesn't belong on this list and the original poster will edit it as necessary.
To keep the list as concise as possible, I've listed only PUBLISHERS as the main entries. Games can be listed as comments or something under the main entries.
[user=zachpas][/user] is much better at this kind of thing than I am. Please follow their example and list some kind of justification for adding an item to the list.
[user=hexahedron][/user] added much more information to this list than I did and had some good ideas that I've implemented.
My apologies to anyone who has subscribed to this list for the multiple edits I've made to the header/title... I think I'm done now and will just let the community to their thing from now on.

[center][b]UPDATE**** March-ish 2020[/b][/center] Plaid Hat has 'divorced' from Asmodee. They will remain with Asmodee for distribution, but a previous owner has bought back most of the company (had to give up the games developed during their time with Asmodee), and they are taking control of their own parts replacement.

Jeux Descartes was acquired by Asmodee in 2004-2005, and its assets became the Descartes Editeur and Eurogames brands.
https://www.mechanics-and-meeples.com/2016/02/08/asmodee-the-other-creature-that-ate-the-gaming-world/
Jeux Descartes was acquired by Asmodee in 2004-2005, and its assets became the Descartes Editeur and Eurogames brands.

http://de.asmodee.com/ressources/articles/asmodee-und-der-heidelberger-spieleverlag-fusionieren.php
From Google Translate:
"Essen, Walldürn, 2 January 2017 - Asmodee and Heidelberger Spieleverlag are proud to announce their merger. Since both publishers have been working closely together in logistics since August 2015, the merger is the perfect step towards furthering their joint success. ..."
https://heidelbaer.de/en/heidelbar-games-becomes-independent-publisher/
They were acquired by Asmodee in 2017 under the Heidelberger Spieleverlag name. Then they split back off in March 2019 under the new HeidelBÄR Games name, but it appears Asmodee is still their distributor.

http://www.edgeent.com/noticias/articulo/buenas_noticias
~Dec 2016, via Google Translate:
" Good news! Edge Entertainment joins the Asmodee group
Dear Friends,
We start the year with good news! Edge Entertainment joins the Asmodee group.
After several of our international partners (Fantasy Flight Games, Days of Wonder, Ystari or Plaid Hat Games, for example) have joined the Asmodee group, we consider this to be the natural step in our development; continue our work with those who in some cases have been our partners for a whole decade, to continue growing with them and give full continuity to the work we have been doing for more than fifteen years.
Joining this great family will mean increasing our resources to make more and better games available to you, and being able to respond to the challenges presented by the future in a more appropriate way.
We will continue to take care of the localization of all the international publishing houses we currently represent to Spanish, and we will be adding more to our catalog over time. Likewise, we will increase our own game production, which thanks to the union of the Asmodee group will be automatically internationalized.
Finally, we want to tell you that our union has been carried out together with that of our sister publisher in France, our distributor in Spain (Millennium) and our counterparts in Germany, Heidelberger Spieleverlag. In this way, cooperation with these companies, which goes back to our origins, is reinforced with the incorporation of all to the same group.
In spite of everything, you will not notice changes in the short term, since our publications will follow each other normally and will continue to be distributed through the same channels. We remain the same group of people doing the same: try to put as many games as possible at your disposal.
We take this opportunity to transfer the best wishes of the Edge Entertainment team to you, your family and friends during 2017.
Happy New Year! "
(I'm adding the Asmodees themselves too, despite its obviousness, since it will get this GL linked to their publisher pages.)
(I'm adding the Asmodees themselves too, despite its obviousness, since it will get this GL linked to their publisher pages.)

"ASMODEE ITALIA SRL, previously known as ASTERION PRESS SRL" is on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).

Bought by Asmodee in the 2016 acquisition of F2Z Entertainment.
https://icv2.com/articles/news/view/35046/asmodee-acquiring-f2z-entertainment

Brazilian company acquired by Asmodee in Aug 2018.
https://www.dicetowernews.com/node/4887 "With the acquisition of long-time partner Galápagos Jogos, Asmodee opens a direct presence in South America"
Under their full formal name "Ilhas Galápagos Comércio de Brinquedos e Serviços LTDA EPP", Galapagos is on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).
Galapagos was the subject of customer complaints in a Mar 2019 [url=https://www.change.org/p/asmodee-na-asmodee-na-and-ffg-pressure-gal%C3%A1pagos-jogos-for-better-community-relations-and-management]Change.org petition[/url].

Asmodee first bought the rights to the Catan line from Mayfair in Jan 2016. Asmodee created Catan Studio to manage that game. https://icv2.com/articles/news/view/33409/asmodee-na-gets-catan
Then in Feb 2018, Mayfair shut down and sold the rest of the company to Asmodee. https://boardgamegeek.com/blogpost/73620/asmodee-acquires-lookout-games-and-mayfair-games

Founded in 2003 in Poland, Rebel was acquired by Asmodee in Jan 2018. https://boardgamegeek.com/blogpost/73264/asmodee-acquire-polish-publisher-rebel https://www.wydawnictworebel.pl/pages/rebel-laczy-sily-z-asmodee-998.html
Rebel is on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).

Lion Rampant Imports, primarily a distributor, was founded in Canada in 1992. It was acquired by Asmodee in Aug 2019. https://corporate.asmodee.com/news/asmodee-acquires-lion-pampant-imports-strenghten-operations-north-america/ https://boardgamegeek.com/blogpost/93420/asmodee-acquires-lion-rampant-imports-gokids-skysh
Lion Rampant is on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).

GoKids, primarily a distributor, was founded in Taiwan in 2010. It was acquired by Asmodee in Aug 2019, and quickly renamed to Asmodee Taiwan. https://corporate.asmodee.com/news/gokids-joins-asmodee-strenghten-group-presence-asia/ https://boardgamegeek.com/blogpost/93420/asmodee-acquires-lion-rampant-imports-gokids-skysh
As "ASMODEE TAÏWAN (formerly KIDS POWER INTERNATIONAL LTD.)", which was the full formal name of GoKids, it is on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).

Acquired by Searainbow in 2018, which was then acquired by Asmodee in 2019.
https://corporate.asmodee.com/news/europe-china-based-childrens-toys-games-specialist-searainbow-joins-asmodee/
" Europe and China based children´s toys and games specialist Searainbow joins Asmodee PUBLISHED ON AUGUST 7, 2019
Asmodee Group has announced the acquisition of the Searainbow Group, a Europe- and Asia-based toys and games publisher, manufacturer and international distributor.
Established in 2004, Searainbow Group started in China as Forever Bright, a producer of innovative educational toys and related specialty items. The company also distributes toys and games to the Asian markets through its subsidiary Wisdom Warehouse. In 2015, Searainbow acquired one of the UK’s market leaders in educational games, The Green Board Game Company. In 2018, the acquisition of Lagoon made Searainbow Group a strong publisher of games and puzzles for gift for UK gift shops. "
Lagoon Trading Co. is on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).

Acquired by Searainbow in 2015, which was then acquired by Asmodee in 2019.
https://corporate.asmodee.com/news/europe-china-based-childrens-toys-games-specialist-searainbow-joins-asmodee/
" Europe and China based children´s toys and games specialist Searainbow joins Asmodee PUBLISHED ON AUGUST 7, 2019
Asmodee Group has announced the acquisition of the Searainbow Group, a Europe- and Asia-based toys and games publisher, manufacturer and international distributor.
Established in 2004, Searainbow Group started in China as Forever Bright, a producer of innovative educational toys and related specialty items. The company also distributes toys and games to the Asian markets through its subsidiary Wisdom Warehouse. In 2015, Searainbow acquired one of the UK’s market leaders in educational games, The Green Board Game Company. In 2018, the acquisition of Lagoon made Searainbow Group a strong publisher of games and puzzles for gift for UK gift shops. "
The Green Board Game Co. is on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).

https://www.mechanics-and-meeples.com/2016/02/08/asmodee-the-other-creature-that-ate-the-gaming-world/
https://www.eurazeo.com/assets-eurazeo/uploads/2015/02/Press-Communique-Asterion-EN.pdf " Asmodee and Asterion merge to develop Italian Board Game Market. Guyancourt (France); Correggio (Italy); February 10th [2015]
Founded by Massimo Bianchini and Luca Cattini, Asterion publishes and distributes boardgames. The company has distributed most of Asmodee’s games since 2010, when the Italian version of Dixit was launched. The strong connection and close relationship between the two companies as well as their shared perspective on the future of boardgames in Italy enabled an open dialogue that led to the purchase of Asterion by Asmodee. "
Asterion Press, having been renamed to Asmodee Italia, is on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).

https://www.mechanics-and-meeples.com/2016/02/08/asmodee-the-other-creature-that-ate-the-gaming-world/
http://www.nextstep-magazine.com/nextstep/private-equity/asmodee-la-carte-gagnante-a-tous-les-coups/&prev=search via [url=https://translate.google.com/translate?hl=en&sl=fr&u=nextstep-magazine.com/nextstep/private-equity/asmodee-la-carte-gagnante-a-tous-les-coups/&prev=search]Google Translate[/url]: "in autumn 2010, Asmodée completed its product portfolio with the acquisition of the strategy game Abalone"
("completed" is obviously not the right translation, lol... they did a whole lot more acquiring after that!)

https://www.mechanics-and-meeples.com/2016/02/08/asmodee-the-other-creature-that-ate-the-gaming-world/
https://www.nobleknight.com/Publisher/Siroz-Productions "Siroz was a French RPG and game publisher, but is now taken over by Asmodee Editions."

Bought by Asmodee in the 2016 acquisition of F2Z Entertainment.
https://icv2.com/articles/news/view/35046/asmodee-acquiring-f2z-entertainment
This part of F2Z was responsible for the app versions of a few board games. The VGG page for the Pandemic app confirms it was acquired by Asmodee along with the other better-known parts of F2Z (Z-Man Games, et al): https://videogamegeek.com/videogame/148659/pandemic-board-game now lists Asmodee Digital as the most recent developer/publisher.

https://www.asmodee.co.uk/news-item/esdevium-games-to-rebrand-to-asmodee-united-kingdom-in-2018/
" Esdevium Games to rebrand to Asmodee United Kingdom in 2018 Posted on 14 Dec 2017
Esdevium Games are proud to announce that, as of January 1st of 2018, they will be rebranding under the name of Asmodee United Kingdom.
Having been part of the Asmodee Group since 2010, the move sees Esdevium matching their parent and sister companies across the world. "
Esdevium is on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).

Not owned by Asmodee, but is distributed *and* manufactured by Asmodee:
https://icv2.com/articles/games/view/13228/asmodee-publish-gameworks-games
" ASMODEE TO PUBLISH GAMEWORKS GAMES Will Manufacture, Distribute Product Line
Posted by ICv2 on September 4, 2008 @ 10:00 am CT
Asmodee Editions ... announced today that it has signed a partnership agreement with Swiss game publisher Gameworks Sarl to become its distribution and manufacturing arm, marketing Gameworks' products in 20 countries worldwide. "

All branches of ADC Blackfire (in Czech Republic, Germany, and Romania) were acquired by Asmodee in late 2018: https://www.dicetowernews.com/node/5087 https://corporate.asmodee.com/news/adc-blackfire-entertainment-exclusive-discussions-join-asmodee-group/
The only press release was about them "entering discussions" for a merger, but it doesn't seem like anybody turns down Asmodee... This article from May 2019 says that ADC Blackfire's accessory products (they're primarily a distributor, but have some of their own unique games and accessories too) are being shuffled around within Asmodee to a new division, so it sounds like the acquisition succeeded. (Edit: Further-confirmed with official Asmodee list below.)
https://icv2.com/articles/news/view/43278/asmodee-launches-gaming-accessory-production-studio
" ASMODEE LAUNCHES GAMING ACCESSORY PRODUCTION STUDIO, Gamegenic Posted by William Niebling on May 23, 2019 @ 7:24 pm CT
Asmodee has announced the creation of a new studio that will be part of its family of companies. Gamegenic will specialize in the development and production of game accessories. Gamegenic will produce a line of premium accessories for games and licensed products, including card sleeves and albums, playmats, storage boxes, and dice. The company plans to offer a diverse portfolio, including products for different price segments. Its line will include items targeted towards new game players and those geared for more experienced collectors. Gamegenic accessories will be sold both directly to consumers and through trade distribution. The new studio will take over the production and development of accessories for the entire Asmodee Group, including the product lines formerly produced by Fantasy Flight and Blackfire. "
(Gamegenic doesn't seem to have a publisher entry available on BGG currently. Its products include many [url=https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/2278124/gamegenic-keyforge-range-under-spotlight-videos]Keyforge accessories[/url] which could be added to the database.)
ADC Blackfire's 3 divisions, in Romania, Czech Republic, and Germany, are on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).
Gamegenic also is on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).
https://www.mechanics-and-meeples.com/2016/02/08/asmodee-the-other-creature-that-ate-the-gaming-world/

Small publisher in Spain. https://mergr.com/cr%C3%B3mola-juegos-sl-acquired-by-asmodee-group "Crómola Juegos SL was acquired by Asmodee Group on January 16, 2009."
https://www.mechanics-and-meeples.com/2016/02/08/asmodee-the-other-creature-that-ate-the-gaming-world/
https://www.pehub.com/28831/ (via Google cache)
" Montefiore-Backed Game Distributer Adds On 16 January 2009
Asmodee Group, a Paris-based distributer and publisher of collectible cards and games, has made three strategic acquisitions: Hodin, a Belgian-based game distributer, Cromola, a Spanish business, and Proludo gmbh, a German company that the Asmodee Group its stake in. Asmodee Group is backed by Montefiore Investment, a French private equity firm.
Paris, January 16th 2009 – Asmodée Group, the leading distributor and publisher of collectible cards and board games, accelerates its European development thanks to targeted acquisitions: • Hodin, a leading player on the games distribution market in Belgium, with a turnover of €10.2 million for the fiscal year 2007/2008; • Cromola, a Spanish innovative company, well positioned on its fast growing market; • Proludo gmbh, a German company in which Asmodée Group increased its stake to control 100% of the company. "

https://www.mechanics-and-meeples.com/2016/02/08/asmodee-the-other-creature-that-ate-the-gaming-world/
https://mergr.com/asmodee-group-acquires-hodin-sa "On January 16, 2009, Asmodee Group acquired Hodin SA"
It was primarily a distributor, but had a few game credits listed. It was quickly absorbed into the rest of Asmodee, and no longer had a working website by 2010.
https://www.pehub.com/28831/ (via Google cache)
" Montefiore-Backed Game Distributer Adds On 16 January 2009
Asmodee Group, a Paris-based distributer and publisher of collectible cards and games, has made three strategic acquisitions: Hodin, a Belgian-based game distributer, Cromola, a Spanish business, and Proludo gmbh, a German company that the Asmodee Group its stake in. Asmodee Group is backed by Montefiore Investment, a French private equity firm.
Paris, January 16th 2009 – Asmodée Group, the leading distributor and publisher of collectible cards and board games, accelerates its European development thanks to targeted acquisitions: • Hodin, a leading player on the games distribution market in Belgium, with a turnover of €10.2 million for the fiscal year 2007/2008; • Cromola, a Spanish innovative company, well positioned on its fast growing market; • Proludo gmbh, a German company in which Asmodée Group increased its stake to control 100% of the company. "

Ubik is on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url])
https://app.mergerlinks.com/transactions/2016-12-09-ubik-sas "8 Dec 2016 - Acquisition by Asmodée Group of Ubik, a French publisher of board games, role-playing games, figurine and card games."

Coiledspring is primarily a distributor. It was founded in 2004, and acquired by Asmodee UK on Mar 27, 2018.
https://www.asmodee.co.uk/news-item/asmodee-uk-purchases-coiledspring-games/
" Asmodee UK purchases Coiledspring Games Posted on 27 Mar 2018
Asmodee UK have purchased fellow UK games distributor Coiledspring Games. The change in ownership, which is effective immediately, sees Coiledspring join the Asmodee Group of games companies across the world.
Founded in 2004, with just one game and one puzzle, Coiledspring have gone on to become a leading name in UK games distribution, carrying a wide range of products also including jigsaws, puzzles and soft toys. Following the acquisition, Coiledspring will continue to operate as a separate entity, run at arm’s length from Asmodee UK’s current operations. "
Coiledspring is on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).

Sombreros Production is on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).
It seems to be part of Repos, which was acquired by Asmodee on Jan 16, 2020 (see Repos entry). No available logo for the Sombrero portion, so I used Repos's.

Although just founded in Belgium in 2018, it has apparently already been quietly acquired by Asmodee? Its games are very adult-oriented (genitalia dice) so Asmodee probably didn't want to have it all over the news.
Cojones Prod is on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).

https://www.eurazeo.com/assets-eurazeo/uploads/2016/01/160127_Asmodee_Enigma_ENG.pdf
" Asmodee acquires Bergsala Enigma and strengthens its operations in Europe Guyancourt (France); Copenhagen (Denmark); January 27th [2016]
The Asmodee Group announced today its’ acquisition of Bergsala Enigma, the leading boardgame and collectible card game distributor in the Nordics (Denmark, Sweden, Norway, Finland) and the Netherlands. The company will operate from now on under its’ original name, Enigma Distribution.
Founded in 2004 by Jesper Danker and Albin Kristenson, Enigma Distribution distributes boardgames and collectible cards (Pokemon, Magic, Yu-Gi-Oh!, Adrenalyn XL) and has been a long-standing distributor of the Asmodee Group studios Days of Wonder and Fantasy Flight Games. "
Enigma's divisions in the Netherlands, Denmark (renamed to Asmodee Nordics), Norway, Sweden, and Finland, are on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).

Bezzerwizzer, best-known for their namesake [thing=32441]trivia game[/thing], was founded in 2006 and was acquired by Asmodee in Jan 2019. https://www.dicetowernews.com/node/5237 https://icv2.com/articles/news/view/42194/asmodee-acquires-nordic-studio
Bezzerwizzer is on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).

Skyship, primarily a distributor, was founded in Chile in 2014, and acquired by Asmodee in July 2019. https://corporate.asmodee.com/news/skyship-joins-asmodee-chile-strenghten-group-presence-latin-america/ https://boardgamegeek.com/blogpost/93420/asmodee-acquires-lion-rampant-imports-gokids-skysh
Under its full formal name "IMPORTADORA Y COMERCIALIZADORA SKYSHIP SpA", Skyship is on the [url=https://corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]official list of Asmodee Group Companies[/url] as of Jan 2020 ([url=http://web.archive.org/web/20200228140235/corporate.asmodee.com/smd-content/uploads/Templates/Asmodee_group_companies_EN.pdf]archive[/url]).

Asmodee does NOT own Mantic, but is now the exclusive US distributor for some of their games.
https://icv2.com/articles/news/view/45390/asmodee-acquires-exclusive-u-s-rights-mantics-hellboy-the-board-game
" ASMODEE ACQUIRES EXCLUSIVE U.S RIGHTS TO MANTIC'S 'HELLBOY: THE BOARD GAME' And Non-Exclusive Rights to 'TerrainCrate' Posted by Milton Griepp on March 10, 2020 @ 4:38 pm CT
Asmodee USA Distribution has acquired exclusive distribution rights to Mantic Games’ "Hellboy: The Board Game" line, the company announced at GAMA Expo today. The deal includes the base game, the expansion "The Wild Hunt" (see “Mantic Games Goes After ‘The Wild Hunt’”), and "Hellboy in Mexico", due out in North America soon. Asmodee will have the Hellboy products available in the U.S. in Q2 2020.
Asmodee will also initiate non-exclusive distribution of Mantic’s TerrainCrate line, the company announced. ... "
[blogpost=106319][/blogpost]
